item.title: Running Trivy Security Scanner from Docker on macOS
item.description: Goal: Run Trivy security scanner using Docker without installing it locally. Official documentation: https://aquasecurity.github.io/trivy/v0.38/ Basic Usage docker run aquasec/trivy version Scan Local Filesystem docker run -v /host/src/to/scan:/target aquasec/trivy --debug fs /target > trivy-output-report.txt Output file is created in your current directory. https://aquasecurity.github.io/trivy/v0.20.2/getting-started/cli/fs/ Scan Git Repository Public repositories only: https://aquasecurity.github.io/trivy/v0.20.2/vulnerability/scanning/git-repository/ docker run aquasec/trivy repo REPO_URL Scan .NET Projects Trivy requires packages.config or *.deps.json files. item.title: Scan for Vulnerabilities with Trivy
item.description: Goal Scan a directory for security vulnerabilities using Trivy. Install Trivy brew install trivy Scan a Directory trivy fs --severity CRITICAL,MEDIUM /path/to/folder This scans the specified folder and reports vulnerabilities with CRITICAL or MEDIUM severity levels.
